meanings.definition: To allow someone to enter a place or organization again after they have been away.
meanings.sent1: The school decided to start readmitting students who had previously dropped out.
meanings.sent2: After serving his suspension, the student was readmitting to the basketball team.
meanings.sent3: The library was readmitting overdue books with no late fees as a special promotion.
meanings.sent4: The theater was readmitting audience members who had left during intermission.
meanings.sent5: The security guard was readmitting visitors after verifying their identification.

meanings.definition: To accept someone back into a hospital, school, or other institution after they have been away for a period of time.
meanings.sent1: The hospital was readmitting the patient for further treatment.
meanings.sent2: The school was readmitting the student who had recovered from an illness.
meanings.sent3: The zoo was readmitting the escaped monkey after a brief chase around the park.
meanings.sent4: The hotel was readmitting guests who had temporarily checked out for a day trip.
meanings.sent5: The museum was readmitting visitors after a temporary closure for renovations.
